channel.title: SQL help with listing
channel.description:
*Fixed
I'm building a forum from scratch using php/mysql. When a topic is added or updated, I want it to go to the top of the table list. That way when I display it on the page, it's ordered starting from the most recent. How can I do this? My Topics table structure is:
topic INT(8), topic_board INT(8), topic_by INT(8), topic_subject VARCHAR(50), topic_content VARCHAR(225), topic_date int(8), topic_sticky enum("normal", "sticky")

item.title: SQL help with listing
item.dc:creator: @runeite51 runeite51
item.description:
@runeite51 wrote:

The Web Guy:

Assign every topic a numerical id. Have it automatically input the id through SQL (in order.) Then, simply select results from the query sorting by highest number first, to lowest number last (DESC).

Well I have to order by date so when someone updates a topic or post the topic goes up to the top.

I would, actually, suggest prepared statements when dealing with SQL. Google up “php PDO” It’s pretty simple and increased security a bunch. Also, IIRC, mysqli has problems with certain SQL data types.

I would recommend it as well, I was just stating that at the very least you should convert to mysqli as it’s non-deprecated.
